title: Bug with the Bandit Mastery
body: The mastery doesn't proc on spells at all, unless they apply on-hit effects like Ezreal's Q. However, the mastery specifies that "hitting a champion with an attack or spell" should proc it. Please fix this, either the proc or the tool tip.

replies.body:
Cannot occur more than once per 5 seconds. Are you hitting too much?

There could just be a bug that is not allowing it to work with spells, since on hit is basically an AA attack combined with a spell it could be that.

No I tried it with Ezreal, Braum (who I was playing when I noticed it) and Pantheon.

Also, when you proc it, you get a "buff" that has the CD of bandit. When it expires, you can proc it again.

At first I thought that it just didn't apply to skills shots and AoE spells, since it never proc'd on Braum's Q or R. So I tried it with Pantheon, since his Q is a single target spell. It didn't proc off of that either, nor his W, E, or R. So then I tried it with Ezreal, since I thought maybe it didn't proc properly for melee champions. It would only proc off of his Q, which applies on-hit effects. Otherwise, it didn't proc off of his W, E, or R.

And this is how I found out that it only currently gets proc'd by AA and spells that apply on-hit effects. So, either it's a bug, or the description of the mastery is wrong. It needs to be fixed.
